css-variables.title: CSS Variables
css-variables.description: CSS variables are so freaking useful and their fast adoption has us more than excited. In this short episode, we discuss them and some of their uses. We discuss implementation and some use cases

designsystems-v2.title: Continuing Design Systems
designsystems-v2.description: What happens when our shiny design system has its first birthday? Chris and Una discuss lessons learned from their years in the field.

graphql.title: GraphQL
graphql.description: Tune in this week to hear us ford through unfamiliar waters as we tackle GraphQL! We go through why you should get excited about this new way of dealing with APIs.

datasketches.title: Data Sketches
datasketches.description: Live from JSConf.EU, we speak with Nadieh Bremer & Shirley Wu about their incredible data sketches project and their experiences with data visualization.

topperftools.title: Our Favorite Perf Tools
topperftools.description: We go through our 8 favorite tools that we use to improve web performance.

hardwarejs.title: Hardware
hardwarejs.description: We talk with Suz Hinton about how to write software interconnected with physical objects. How cool is that wizardry!?

cssgrids.title: CSS Grid
cssgrids.description: Everyone’s talking about CSS Grid—the latest spec to surface in modern browsers. Listen up on why its so great!

vr.title: Virtual Reality
vr.description: What's super trendy in tech right now? Virtual Reality. We break it down this week at SXSW.

gifv.title: .gifv
gifv.description: We talk to Jason Ormand about gifv! The latest in image performance technology. No but really, it's pretty cool.

git.title: Git Tools
git.description: Git is something we use every day—this week we talk about some tools, tips, and tricks to make it better.

windows.title: Windows
windows.description: What is Windows up to these days? Una and Chris give you the down low of developing on this operating system in 2017!

webpack2.title: Webpack 2
webpack2.description: This week we sit down and talk with Sean Larkin about newly released Webpack 2! ES6 modules, tree-shaking, and more fun things in this episode.

cssinjs.title: CSS in JS
cssinjs.description: CSS in JS: is it the next big thing? We break down some techniques with Glen Maddern

newtous2016.title: Discovered in 2016
newtous2016.description: Every year introduces new tools. We recount our favorite discoveries from 2016.

animationtools.title: Animation Tools with Sarah
animationtools.description: This week we learn about animation in UI: basics, libraries, performance considerations, and more with Sarah Drasner.

fitness.title: Fitness Tools
fitness.description: We care about you! This week we talk about tools that can help you stay healthy and productive.

images.title: Images!
images.description: This week's episode is full of image optimization tooks, formats, and some fun facts about images!

chromeextensions.title: Chrome Extensions
chromeextensions.description: We rapid fire through our favourite Chrome extensions

conferencespeaking.title: Tech Conference Speaking
conferencespeaking.description: Chris interviews Una on her experience as a conference speaker and how you can become one too!

vscode.title: Visual Studio Code
vscode.description: We stray off the beaten road of Atom and Sublime, and instead discuss our new favourite editor, Visual Studio Code, and our top five extensions for it.

stateofjs.title: State of Javascript
stateofjs.description: We’re back! With an overview of what people have been talking about lately: the abundance of tools in web development.

conferencetalks.title: Conference Talks
conferencetalks.description: We highlight thirteen conference talks that dazzled us, inspired us, and drove our careers forward

travel.title: Travel Tools
travel.description: After a short hiatus, Toolsday returns with CSS Wizardry himself, Harry Roberts, to talk about travel.

travis.title: Travis CI
travis.description: Mathias, CEO of Travis CI, comes on the show to give us an overview of what Travis CI is and how it can help your next project.

standards.title: Standards and Linters
standards.description: What’s the “correct” way to write code? We can’t say for sure, but these standards and linters can. This week we explore the options.

cssframeworks.title: CSS Frameworks
cssframeworks.description: CSS frameworks / design systems/ pattern libraries — so many names, so little time! We revisit the topic with so much more knowledges.

hardware.title: Our Hardware!
hardware.description: We chat about how we use completely different hardware to do our work

firefoxdev.title: Firefox Dev Tools
firefoxdev.description: We had Helen Holmes, UI designer of Firefox Dev tools to teach us some tricks we didn't know existed!

variety-show.title: The Variety Show
variety-show.description: The tools we love and use that we forgot or just didn't fit into any other category.

serviceworkers.title: Service Workers
serviceworkers.description: We poke around, ruminate, and explore Service Workers.

offline-web.title: Offline-first
offline-web.description: How can we make sure people are able to access data on poor connections? Hear about offline-first this week with Hoodie's Gregor Martynus.

systemtools.title: System Tools
systemtools.description: Some of the things you'll need to set up a MacBook from scratch, and some fun quirks that will make your life easier day to day.

topten.title: Top 10 Tools
topten.description: For our 20th episode, we do a recap of our favourite tools that we use everyday.

accessibility.title: Web Accessibility
accessibility.description: This week we talk about web accessibility concerns — what the heck all those acronyms are, and how to test for compliance.

animation.title: (Mostly CSS) Animation
animation.description: Animation brings the web to life! Today we talk about (mostly CSS) animation — how it works, tools, and resources.

unittesting.title: Unit Testing
unittesting.description: Today we discuss JavaScript unit testing with ColbyCheeze! Learn about spying, stubbing, and mocking this week.

gameengines.title: Game Engines
gameengines.description: Achieved in CryEngine 3 — wait no, Unity, wait no, Phaser?

css-layout.title: CSS Layout
css-layout.description: This week we're talking CSS layout — from CSS 1 to current best practices to what's coming down the pipeline.

performance.title: Performance Profiling
performance.description: We all agree performance testing is important, but how do you track it over time? This week Taylor Jones tells us how.

static-site-gens.title: Static Site Generators
static-site-gens.description: There are 412 options for static site generators. This week we discuss (mostly three) of them.

es6.title: Solved by ES6 (ES2015)
es6.description: We picked our top five ES6/7/2015/2016 upgrades and talk about how they make our lives so much easier.

express.title: Express & Middleware
express.description: Our guest Jon Ballands chats with us about the IBM Swift Sandbox, and building it with Node & Express.

ember.title: Ember
ember.description: With frameworks being so hot right now, we talk to Iheanyi Ekechukwu about Ember

react.title: React
react.description: This week we talk about React and why it's so darn hard to get started with!

devtools.title: Chrome DevTools
devtools.description: Chrome DevTools is the topic of the week, which we've simply deemed "awesome".

preprocessors.title: CSS Processors
preprocessors.description: This week's episode is about the past, present and future of CSS Pre and Post-processors.

remote-collaboration.title: Remote Collaboration
remote-collaboration.description: Absence makes the heart grow fonder? Let's talk about remote collaboration and the tools that make it possible.

dev-environment.title: Developer Environment
dev-environment.description: Sublime or Atom? Wait, WEBSTORM? We talk about our favourite developer environment tips and tricks.

styleguides-at-scale.title: Styleguides at Scale
styleguides-at-scale.description: We discuss the challenges of creating scalable styleguides with guest Brian Han

learning-tools.title: Learning Tools
learning-tools.description: College? Where we're going, we don't need college (or do we?).

module-loaders.title: Module Loaders
module-loaders.description: We'll talk about modules and module loaders! Everything from AMD to common.js and spend a bit of time going over Browserify and Webpack.

task-runners.title: Task Runners
task-runners.description: Grunt, Gulp, Broccoli, Brunch, Mimosa, oh my! So many task runners, so little time. In this weeks episode, we explore each of these delectable breakfast items/task runners.
